Update details of a specific location, based on its ID.

data.current_description:
Initiate a payment to pay full amount for an order using a customer's saved payment method.

:::note
The `/orders/{order_id}/confirm` endpoint has been deprecated. It will be only supported for already existing implementations.
 :::

:::caution
This endpoint is part of a new API, pay attention to the different endpoint URL. 
:::

For more information about how to save and charge payment methods, see: [Charge a customer's saved payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/save-and-charge-payment-methods/charge-saved-payment-method).
 
The following table shows who can initiate payments on saved payment methods (`initiator` parameter), depending on if the payment method was saved for the customer or the merchant (`savedPaymentMethodFor` parameter):

  |                           | `savePaymentMethodFor: customer` | `savePaymentMethodFor: merchant` |
  | ------------------------- | -------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
  | **`initiator: customer`** | Allowed                          | Allowed                          |
  | **`initiator: merchant`** | Not allowed                      | Allowed                          |


:::note
Using this endpoint, only merchant initiated payments are supported with Revolut Pay.
:::
          
For more information about customers' payment methods, see the [Retrieve all payment methods of a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-all-payment-methods) operation.
data.summary_suggestion: Initiate payment using saved payment method
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a payment to charge the full order amount using a customer's saved payment method. Requires the order ID and a valid saved payment method identifier. Supports both merchant-initiated and customer-initiated transactions, subject to payment method storage context (customer vs. merchant). Returns a Payment object with transaction details and status. This operation transitions the order toward completion and may trigger webhook events (ORDER_AUTHORISED, ORDER_COMPLETED).

Create a `customer` that has the information in the body of the request.

:::note
If you wish to save a customer's payment details using any of the available payment methods on the Revolut Checkout Widget ([Revolut Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/revolut-pay/introduction), [Card payments](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/card-payments/introduction)), you need to meet one of the following requirements:

data.current_description:
Create an `Order` object.

Creating orders is one of the basic operations of the Merchant API. Most of the other operations are related to creating orders. Furthermore, the payment methods merchants can use to take payments for their orders are also built on order creation.

To learn more about how you can accept payments, see:
  - [Revolut Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/revolut-pay/introduction)
  - [Card payments](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/card-payments/introduction)
  - [Apple Pay and Google Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/apple-pay-google-pay/introduction)
  - [Payment links](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/payment-link)
 
<details>
<summary>Industry-specific requirements</summary>

If you operate in any of the industries listed below, sharing industry-specific data is highly encouraged. Not providing the necessary information may result in further scrutiny from the Revolut risk team and/or the imposition of risk mitigation actions.

| Industry | Related fields |
| ------- | --------------- |
 | Retail merchants | `line_items`, `shipping` |
| Airlines and Online Travel Agencies (OTAs) | `industry_data` with `type: airline` |
| Crypto merchants | `industry_data` with `type: crypto` |
| Marketplace merchants | `industry_data` with `type: marketplace` |
| Event ticket sellers | `industry_data` with `type: event` |
| Lodging providers | `industry_data` with `type: lodging` |

</details>
data.summary_suggestion: Create an order for payment processing
data.description_suggestion: Creates an Order object to initiate payment processing for customer purchases. The order serves as the foundation for accepting payments via multiple methods (Revolut Pay, card payments, Apple Pay, Google Pay). Returns an Order object with a unique token for use with the Revolut Checkout Widget. Industry-specific data (line_items, shipping, industry_data) should be included when applicable to your merchant category (retail, airlines, crypto, marketplace, events, lodging) to ensure compliance and reduce risk scrutiny.

data.current_description:
Update the details of an order. You can update an order and specific parameters based on the value of the `state` parameter: | State parameter value | Modifiable parameters | | --------------------- | --------------------- | | `pending` | You can modify all listed parameters. | | `authorised` | You can modify the following parameters:

  • `merchant_order_data.reference`
  • `description`
  • `metadata`
  • `shipping`
  • `industry_data`
  • `cancel_authorised_after`
| | `completed` | You can modify the following parameters:

  • `merchant_order_data.reference`
  • `description`
  • `metadata`
  • `shipping`
  • `industry_data`
| | `processing` | You cannot modify parameters. | :::info For more information about the order lifecycle, see: [Order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/other-resources/order-payment-flow). :::
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing order's details based on its current state. Modifiable parameters vary by order state: `pending` orders allow full updates; `authorised` orders allow updates to merchant_order_data.reference, description, metadata, shipping, industry_data, and cancel_authorised_after; `completed` orders allow updates to merchant_order_data.reference, description, metadata, shipping, and industry_data; `processing` orders cannot be modified. Returns the updated Order object. Requires the order ID and current order state to determine which fields can be modified.

data.current_description:
This endpoint is used to capture the funds of an existing, uncaptured order. When the payment for an order is authorised, you can capture the order to send it to the processing stage. :::info For more information about the order and payment lifecycle, see: [Order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/other-resources/order-payment-flow). ::: ## Capture modes When you [create an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-order), you can choose one of the following capture modes: | **Capture mode** | **Description** | | ---------------- | --------------- | | `automatic` | The order is captured automatically after payment authorisation. No further actions are needed. | | `manual` | The order is not captured automatically and stays in `authorised` state. You must manually capture the order using the steps outlined below. | :::caution Uncaptured orders remain in `authorised` state **for 7 days**. If not captured within this period, the funds are returned to the customer's original payment method. ::: ### Manual capture To capture an order manually, use one of the following methods: | **Web UI** | **Merchant API** | | ---------- | ------------ | |
  1. Log in to your [Revolut Business portal](https://business.revolut.com).
  2. Navigate to the **Merchant** tab on the dashboard, and click the **See all** button in the **Transactions** section.
  3. Select an uncaptured payment, and click **Capture**.
| Use the `/capture` endpoint. | :::info For more information about manually capturing an order, see: [Authorise an amount to capture later](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/capture-later). ::: #### Partial capture You have the option to capture only a fraction of the full amount. In such cases, the uncaptured portion of the amount will be voided. :::caution The following limitations apply to manual captures: - It's not possible to capture an amount multiple times - Captured amount can't exceed the authorised amount - On Web UI, only capturing full amount is possible - `0` amount captures are not allowed - For partial captures, you can only resend the request with the initial amount ::: ## Idempotency and repeated requests The capture operation is idempotent. This means that an order can only be captured once. If you send a capture request more than once: - The first valid request captures the order and moves it to the processing stage. - Any subsequent capture requests for the same order will not recapture the funds. Instead, these requests will behave like a [Retrieve an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-order) request. The response will provide the current state of the order as if you queried it using the order retrieval endpoint. :::info Utilising the idempotent nature of this endpoint helps maintain data consistency and prevents duplicate processing of the same order. :::
data.summary_suggestion: Capture authorized order funds for processing
data.description_suggestion: Captures funds from an authorized order, moving it to the processing stage. Only applicable to orders with capture_mode set to `manual` that are in `authorised` state. Supports full or partial capture (uncaptured portion is voided). Requires order ID and optional amount for partial captures. Returns the updated Order object in `processing` state. Operation is idempotentonly the first valid request captures funds; subsequent requests return current order state. Uncaptured orders expire after 7 days and funds are returned to customer. Limitations: cannot capture multiple times, captured amount cannot exceed authorized amount, zero-amount captures not allowed.

data.current_description:
Cancel an existing uncaptured order.

You can only cancel an order that is in one of the following states:
  
  | Order state | Description |
  | ----------- | ----------- |
  | `pending` | The order does not have any successful payment. |
  | `authorised` | The `capture_mode` of an order is set to `manual` and the customer has made a successful payment. |

:::info
 For more information about the order lifecycle, see: [Order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/other-resources/order-payment-flow).
:::
data.description_suggestion: Cancels an uncaptured order, releasing any authorized funds back to the customer. Only orders in `pending` state (no successful payment) or `authorised` state (manual capture_mode with successful payment) can be cancelled. Requires the order ID. Returns the updated Order object in `cancelled` state. Cancellation is permanent and cannot be reversed.

When you use this request to update a customer's payment method, the payment method can't be used for merchant initiated transactions (MIT) any more. This payment method can be used only when the customer is on the checkout page.


For more information about the limitations introduced by this parameter, see: 
  - [Pay for an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/pay-order)
  - [Charge a customer's saved payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/save-and-charge-payment-methods/charge-saved-payment-method)
data.description_suggestion: Update a customer's payment method to restrict its usage. When updated, the payment method becomes unavailable for merchant-initiated transactions (MIT) and can only be used when the customer is actively on the checkout page. This operation modifies the payment method's transaction capabilities and returns the updated payment method object. Refer to the Pay for an order and Charge a customer's saved payment method guides for details on transaction type limitations.

Ensure your webhook registrations are necessary and within the allowed limit.

data.current_description:
Initiate a payment to pay full amount for an order using a customer's saved payment method.

:::note
The `/orders/{order_id}/confirm` endpoint has been deprecated. It will be only supported for already existing implementations.
 :::

:::caution
This endpoint is part of a new API, pay attention to the different endpoint URL. 
:::

For more information about how to save and charge payment methods, see: [Charge a customer's saved payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/save-and-charge-payment-methods/charge-saved-payment-method).
 
The following table shows who can initiate payments on saved payment methods (`initiator` parameter), depending on if the payment method was saved for the customer or the merchant (`savedPaymentMethodFor` parameter):

  |                           | `savePaymentMethodFor: customer` | `savePaymentMethodFor: merchant` |
  | ------------------------- | -------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
  | **`initiator: customer`** | Allowed                          | Allowed                          |
  | **`initiator: merchant`** | Not allowed                      | Allowed                          |


:::note
Using this endpoint, only merchant initiated payments are supported with Revolut Pay.
:::
          
For more information about customers' payment methods, see the [Retrieve all payment methods of a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-all-payment-methods) operation.
data.summary_suggestion: Initiate payment using saved payment method
data.description_suggestion: Initiates a payment to charge the full order amount using a customer's saved payment method. Requires the order ID and a valid saved payment method identifier. Supports both merchant-initiated and customer-initiated transactions, subject to payment method storage context (customer vs. merchant). Returns a Payment object with transaction details and status. This operation transitions the order toward completion and may trigger webhook events (ORDER_AUTHORISED, ORDER_COMPLETED).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (order_id, payment method identifier), expected output (Payment object), and side effects (order state transitions, webhook events). Added specificity about initiator rules and state changes for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Create a `customer` that has the information in the body of the request.

:::note
If you wish to save a customer's payment details using any of the available payment methods on the Revolut Checkout Widget ([Revolut Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/revolut-pay/introduction), [Card payments](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/card-payments/introduction)), you need to meet one of the following requirements:

  - Have a customer object with `email` and assign it to the order by providing `customer.id`
  - Create a new customer with, at least, `customer.email` during [order creation](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-order)

For more information, see: [Charge a customer's saved payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/save-and-charge-payment-methods/charge-saved-payment-method).
::::
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Customer object to track and manage customer transactions. Requires at least an email address if you plan to save payment methods. Returns a Customer object with a unique ID that can be used to associate orders and payment methods. The created customer ID enables payment method storage and retrieval for future transactions. Email is mandatory for payment method saving functionality.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity on required fields (email requirement), return value (Customer object with ID), and side effects (enables payment method association). Added specificity about email requirement for payment method functionality and the returned Customer object structure.

data.current_description:
Create an `Order` object.

Creating orders is one of the basic operations of the Merchant API. Most of the other operations are related to creating orders. Furthermore, the payment methods merchants can use to take payments for their orders are also built on order creation.

To learn more about how you can accept payments, see:
  - [Revolut Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/revolut-pay/introduction)
  - [Card payments](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/card-payments/introduction)
  - [Apple Pay and Google Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/apple-pay-google-pay/introduction)
  - [Payment links](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/payment-link)
 
<details>
<summary>Industry-specific requirements</summary>

If you operate in any of the industries listed below, sharing industry-specific data is highly encouraged. Not providing the necessary information may result in further scrutiny from the Revolut risk team and/or the imposition of risk mitigation actions.

| Industry | Related fields |
| ------- | --------------- |
 | Retail merchants | `line_items`, `shipping` |
| Airlines and Online Travel Agencies (OTAs) | `industry_data` with `type: airline` |
| Crypto merchants | `industry_data` with `type: crypto` |
| Marketplace merchants | `industry_data` with `type: marketplace` |
| Event ticket sellers | `industry_data` with `type: event` |
| Lodging providers | `industry_data` with `type: lodging` |

</details>
data.summary_suggestion: Create an order for payment processing
data.description_suggestion: Creates an Order object to initiate payment processing for customer purchases. The order serves as the foundation for accepting payments via multiple methods (Revolut Pay, card payments, Apple Pay, Google Pay). Returns an Order object with a unique token for use with the Revolut Checkout Widget. Industry-specific data (line_items, shipping, industry_data) should be included when applicable to your merchant category (retail, airlines, crypto, marketplace, events, lodging) to ensure compliance and reduce risk scrutiny.

data.current_description:
This endpoint is used to capture the funds of an existing, uncaptured order. When the payment for an order is authorised, you can capture the order to send it to the processing stage. :::info For more information about the order and payment lifecycle, see: [Order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/other-resources/order-payment-flow). ::: ## Capture modes When you [create an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/create-order), you can choose one of the following capture modes: | **Capture mode** | **Description** | | ---------------- | --------------- | | `automatic` | The order is captured automatically after payment authorisation. No further actions are needed. | | `manual` | The order is not captured automatically and stays in `authorised` state. You must manually capture the order using the steps outlined below. | :::caution Uncaptured orders remain in `authorised` state **for 7 days**. If not captured within this period, the funds are returned to the customer's original payment method. ::: ### Manual capture To capture an order manually, use one of the following methods: | **Web UI** | **Merchant API** | | ---------- | ------------ | |
  1. Log in to your [Revolut Business portal](https://business.revolut.com).
  2. Navigate to the **Merchant** tab on the dashboard, and click the **See all** button in the **Transactions** section.
  3. Select an uncaptured payment, and click **Capture**.
| Use the `/capture` endpoint. | :::info For more information about manually capturing an order, see: [Authorise an amount to capture later](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/capture-later). ::: #### Partial capture You have the option to capture only a fraction of the full amount. In such cases, the uncaptured portion of the amount will be voided. :::caution The following limitations apply to manual captures: - It's not possible to capture an amount multiple times - Captured amount can't exceed the authorised amount - On Web UI, only capturing full amount is possible - `0` amount captures are not allowed - For partial captures, you can only resend the request with the initial amount ::: ## Idempotency and repeated requests The capture operation is idempotent. This means that an order can only be captured once. If you send a capture request more than once: - The first valid request captures the order and moves it to the processing stage. - Any subsequent capture requests for the same order will not recapture the funds. Instead, these requests will behave like a [Retrieve an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-order) request. The response will provide the current state of the order as if you queried it using the order retrieval endpoint. :::info Utilising the idempotent nature of this endpoint helps maintain data consistency and prevents duplicate processing of the same order. :::
data.summary_suggestion: Capture authorized order funds for processing
data.description_suggestion: Captures funds from an authorized order, moving it to the processing stage. Only applicable to orders with capture_mode set to `manual` that are in `authorised` state. Supports full or partial capture (uncaptured portion is voided). Requires order ID and optional amount for partial captures. Returns the updated Order object in `processing` state. Operation is idempotentonly the first valid request captures funds; subsequent requests return current order state. Uncaptured orders expire after 7 days and funds are returned to customer. Limitations: cannot capture multiple times, captured amount cannot exceed authorized amount, zero-amount captures not allowed.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description is comprehensive but verbose and lacks clear input/output specification. AI agents need to understand: when to use this (only for manual capture_mode orders in authorised state), what inputs are required (order ID, optional amount), what is returned (updated Order object), and key constraints (7-day expiration, idempotency, partial capture rules). Improved version provides concise, actionable guidance for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Cancel an existing uncaptured order.

You can only cancel an order that is in one of the following states:
  
  | Order state | Description |
  | ----------- | ----------- |
  | `pending` | The order does not have any successful payment. |
  | `authorised` | The `capture_mode` of an order is set to `manual` and the customer has made a successful payment. |

:::info
 For more information about the order lifecycle, see: [Order and payment lifecycle](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/other-resources/order-payment-flow).
:::
data.description_suggestion: Cancels an uncaptured order, releasing any authorized funds back to the customer. Only orders in `pending` state (no successful payment) or `authorised` state (manual capture_mode with successful payment) can be cancelled. Requires the order ID. Returns the updated Order object in `cancelled` state. Cancellation is permanent and cannot be reversed.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate and clear. Description explains which states allow cancellation but lacks explicit information about: what input is required (order ID), what is returned (updated Order object with cancelled state), and side effects (funds released, action is permanent). Improved description adds these critical details for AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
Update details of a specific location, based on its ID. 

:::note
 The value of the location's `type` parameter cannot be updated.
:::
data.description_suggestion: Update details of a specific location by its ID. Supports partial updates of location configuration. Note that the location's `type` parameter is immutable and cannot be modified. Returns the updated location object with all current configuration details.
data.reasoning: While the summary is adequate, the description lacks clarity about what is returned and doesn't explicitly state that this is a partial update operation. data.current_description: Delete a specific location, based on its ID.

data.description_suggestion: Retrieve detailed information about a specific saved payment method for a customer. Useful for verifying payment method information before processing transactions or displaying saved payment options to customers.

data.current_description:
When you use this request to update a customer's payment method, the payment method can't be used for merchant initiated transactions (MIT) any more. This payment method can be used only when the customer is on the checkout page.


For more information about the limitations introduced by this parameter, see: 
  - [Pay for an order](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/pay-order)
  - [Charge a customer's saved payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/save-and-charge-payment-methods/charge-saved-payment-method)
data.description_suggestion: Update a customer's payment method to restrict its usage. When updated, the payment method becomes unavailable for merchant-initiated transactions (MIT) and can only be used when the customer is actively on the checkout page. This operation modifies the payment method's transaction capabilities and returns the updated payment method object. Refer to the Pay for an order and Charge a customer's saved payment method guides for details on transaction type limitations.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description focuses heavily on side effects but lacks clarity about what inputs are expected and what the operation returns. Enhanced description clarifies the action, its effects, expected return value, and maintains reference to relevant guides for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
Retrieve a list of disputes associated with your merchant account. :::note This endpoint is only available in **Production** environment. ::: You can also use the query parameters for: | Filtering | Pagination | | --------- | ---------- | | Filter the diputes that you want to retrieve, for example, only retrieve the disputes that have a specific state.

Parameters used for filtering:
  • `from_created_date`
  • `to_created_date`
  • `payment_id`
  • `state`
| View the disputes without loading all of them at once, for example, return a specified number of disputes per page.

Parameters used for pagination:
  • `limit`
  • `from_created_date` or `to_created_date`
|
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve merchant disputes with filtering and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve a paginated list of disputes associated with your merchant account. Supports filtering by creation date range, payment ID, and dispute state. Returns an array of dispute objects with their current states and details. Available only in Production environment. Use filtering parameters to narrow results by specific criteria and pagination parameters to control result set size.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic ('a dispute list'). Description is comprehensive but could be more concise about return values. data.current_description:
Initiate a payment to pay full amount for an order using a customer's saved payment method.

:::note
The `/orders/{order_id}/confirm` endpoint has been deprecated. It will be only supported for already existing implementations.
 :::

:::caution
This endpoint is part of a new API, pay attention to the different endpoint URL. 
:::

For more information about how to save and charge payment methods, see: [Charge a customer's saved payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/save-and-charge-payment-methods/charge-saved-payment-method).
 
The following table shows who can initiate payments on saved payment methods (`initiator` parameter), depending on if the payment method was saved for the customer or the merchant (`savedPaymentMethodFor` parameter):

  |                           | `savePaymentMethodFor: customer` | `savePaymentMethodFor: merchant` |
  | ------------------------- | -------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
  | **`initiator: customer`** | Allowed                          | Allowed                          |
  | **`initiator: merchant`** | Not allowed                      | Allowed                          |


:::note
Using this endpoint, only merchant initiated payments are supported with Revolut Pay.
:::
          
For more information about customers' payment methods, see the [Retrieve all payment methods of a customer](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/merchant/retrieve-all-payment-methods) operation.
data.summary_suggestion: Initiate payment using saved payment method

Supports both merchant-initiated and customer-initiated transactions, subject to payment method storage context (customer vs. merchant). Returns a Payment object with transaction details and status. This operation transitions the order toward completion and may trigger webhook events (ORDER_AUTHORISED, ORDER_COMPLETED).
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (order_id, payment method identifier), expected output (Payment object), and side effects (order state transitions, webhook events). data.current_description:
Create a `customer` that has the information in the body of the request.

:::note
If you wish to save a customer's payment details using any of the available payment methods on the Revolut Checkout Widget ([Revolut Pay](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/revolut-pay/introduction), [Card payments](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/payment-methods/card-payments/introduction)), you need to meet one of the following requirements:

  - Have a customer object with `email` and assign it to the order by providing `customer.id`

For more information, see: [Charge a customer's saved payment method](https://developer.revolut.com/docs/guides/accept-payments/tutorials/save-and-charge-payment-methods/charge-saved-payment-method).
::::
